#summary Steps to use Eneter Protobuf Serializer

= Getting Started =

== Environment ==
Eneter.ProtoBuf.Serializer integrates Protocol Buffers with Eneter Messaging Framework. Therefore based on the platform you may need to reference following libraries from your project:
 * Android
  * protobuf-2.5.0.jar
  * eneter-protobuf-serializer-android-1.0.0.jar
  * eneter-messaging-android-5.1.0.jar
 * Java
  * protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar
  * eneter-protobuf-serializer-1.0.0.jar
  * eneter-messaging-5.1.0.jar
 * .NET platforms
  * protobuf-net.dll
  * Eneter.ProtoBuf.Serializer.dll
  * Eneter.Messaging.Framework.dll
 * Silverlight
  * protobuf-net.dll
  * Eneter.ProtoBuf.Serializer.Silverlight.dll
  * Eneter.Messaging.Framework.Silverlight.dll
 * Phone 7.1
  * protobuf-net.dll
  * Eneter.ProtoBuf.Serializer.Phone.dll
  * Eneter.Messaging.Framework.Phone.dll
 * Compact Framework
  * protobuf-net.dll
  * Eneter.ProtoBuf.Serializer.CF.dll
  * Eneter.Messaging.Framework.CF.dll

The mentioned libraries can be obtained (downloaded and/or compiled) from their original pages:
 * [https://code.google.com/p/protobuf/ *protobuf library*] for Java and Android is from Google.
 * [https://code.google.com/p/protobuf-net/ *protobuf-net library*] for .NET, Windows Phone, Silverlight and Compact Framework is developed by Marc Gravell.
 * [http://www.eneter.net/ProductDownload.htm *Eneter.Messaging.Framework*] as cross-platform framework developed by Ondrej Uzovic.
